Text: Take this!
Whew... We did it!
Jeez, what a weakling!

Thought they'd have more backbone living in such a
dangerous forest.

True, the monsters are displaying fewer signs of
mutation than I anticipated.
Mutation?
...Um, explain it a little simpler!

Let's see... The Abyss Woods is overflowing with
poisonous fog.

We've been trying to avoid it as we make our way
through the woods.

But the monsters we've encountered haven't adapted
to the fog and live their lives avoiding its poison.

In other words, the fog hasn't been around for long
since the monsters haven't had enough time to
adapt to it.

If the monsters haven't adapted...does that mean the
fog isn't natural?!

How unusually perceptive of you, Delta. Yes, that's
most likely the case.

Course I am, Gamma! Can't hunt without knowing the
ways of nature!

You didn't even know that being so smart? No wonder
you're still a weakling.

Ouch... Anyway, we should assume some singular entity
deliberately created this fog.

Are you suggesting this singular entity is the Mist
Dragon described in folklore?

I'm not so sure about that one. Legends are just
legends, and folklore is no different from gossip
until proven otherwise.

But the fact is there are records, and we're
witnessing the poison fog first-hand...

It's pretty clear that whatever lives in this forest
is no joke.

All the more reason to use these woods as our
hideout.
Even the Seven Shadows seem to be on high alert.
Far better than treating this as an excursion.

Especially Delta... She instantly perceived these
woods to be dangerous. I'm sure her sharp
intuition will be invaluable here.

Based on Lady Zeta's preliminary investigation, I've
made all possible preparations, bringing along enough
members to the extent they won't get in the way. Butâ€”
Heh... Are you uncertain, Lambda?

It's my job to tackle uncertainties and prepare for
eventualities by training members and organizing
our units.

I know this is slightly off topic, but may I ask you
a difficult question?
Difficult or not, I'll answer any question you have.

As someone likely once involved in high-ranking
military service, what do you think of the Seven
Shadows' swordsmanship?
...Well.

If I can give my honest opinion, putting aside
individual abilities, I feel there is some
imbalance.

I'm told Master Shadow originally trained each of
the Seven Shadows in the sword.

Shadow had me and Beta train in his own style of
swordsmanship using a blade similar to his own.

But after training Gamma and Delta for some
time, he changed his instructions and had each of
us develop our unique styles, and then stopped
actively teaching the sword.

Because of that, each of us has come to use our
preferred weapon.

I see... I don't know if that's the cause, but I have
some concerns, especially regarding Lady
Epsilon's swordsmanship.

Perhaps it's due to her creativity...but unlike the
swordsmanship Master Shadow taught the other
Seven Shadows, her style appears self-taught,
with an emphasis on magic control.

Lady Epsilon's swordsmanship is unique to the point
that anyone knowledgeable in the sword can recognize
it at a glance.

As for Lady Gamma and Lady Delta, their swordsmanship
is far too primitive and reliant on brute force. They could
both use some form of retraining...at least in my opinion.

Shadow must have anticipated and factored in such
stylistic deviations in their sword technique. After all,
everything he does is part of a greater design.

Still, as members of the Shadow Garden, itâ€™s an
absolute requirement that the Seven Shadows
train in Shadow's swordsmanship.

Thank you, Lambda. I'll continue to rely on you for
such matters.
Of course. That is what I'm here for...
To serve Master Shadow and the Shadow Garden.
